entry.title: TUMO plans 16 more tech hubs in Armenia with support from Yemenidjian family

media:group.media:title: TUMO plans 16 more tech hubs in Armenia with support from Yemenidjian family
media:group.media:description:
Freedom House has published its freedom on the internet report, in which Armenia has declined by 4 points compared to 2020.
The Asian Development Bank has revised up its economic growth forecast for Armenia from 1.8% to 5.2%.
The TUMO Center for Creative Technologies has announced plans to establish 16 tech hubs in the next five years.

entry.title: The Story of Three Italians in Gyumri | La storia di tre italiani a Gyumri

media:group.media:title: The Story of Three Italians in Gyumri | La storia di tre italiani a Gyumri
media:group.media:description:
The stories of Italians Massimiliano â€œMaxâ€ Floriani Antonio Montalto, and Marzio converge in Gyumri, Armeniaâ€™s second largest city. Max, together with his wife Mariam, has restored a neoclassical style house, typical of old Gyumri, to an Italian-Armenian bed and breakfast. Antonio, who is Italyâ€™s Honorary Consul to Armenia and founder of the Family Care Foundation, has set up a ceramics workshop and restoration activities in Gyumriâ€™s historic center. Marzio, on the other hand, trains the employees of the Zakaryan company to make denim. What they share in their experiences is above all their affection for Gyumri, a city full of challenges, but one that has welcomed them for years.
Le storie di Massimiliano Floriani, detto â€œMaxâ€,trentino, Antonio Montalto, siciliano e Marzio, marchigiano convergono a Gyumri, la seconda cittÃ piÃ¹ importante armena. Max, insieme alla moglie Mariam ha restaurato una casa in stile neoclassico, tipica della Gyumri antica, creandovi un b&b in stile italo-armeno. Antonio, Console Onorario e creatore della fondazione Family Care ha avviato un laboratorio di ceramiche oltre ad attivitÃ turistiche e di restauro del centro storico di Gyumri. Marzio invece, forma gli impiegati della societÃ Zakaryan a creare denim. Sono i primi ad aver avviato unâ€™attivitÃ simile in Armenia. Ad accomunare le loro esperienze Ã¨ soprattutto lâ€™affetto nei confronti di questa cittÃ , talvolta difficile, ma che da anni li accoglie.

entry.title: 10 Years on the Air With CivilNet

media:group.media:title: 10 Years on the Air With CivilNet
media:group.media:description:
Armenia marks 30 years of independence on September 21. CivilNet marks 10. Armenian authorities have decided to hold a large-scale celebration on that day. CivilNet will continue to cover protests, human interest stories, sad stories, happy stories, political turns, revolutions, wars, elections, and well - just life. All the things that matter to Armenia.
Through these years, CivilNetâ€™s staff has been on the ground as witnesses to events. Journalists, cameramen and video editors give voice to a society, they are the ones who tell peopleâ€™s stories and inform the public. We are those journalists, cameramen and editors. Today, we are in front of the camera remembering the biggest moments of the last decade.

media:group.media:description:
Armenia celebrates 30 years of independence. On the same day, CivilNet turns 10. What was CivilNetâ€™s mission throughout these years, how did the media transform during this decade, what were the most striking events, and how should media tackle the challenges of today and tomorrow?
